New Records: Germany achieved their biggest European Championship win with a 5-1 victory over Scotland.
Jamal Musiala became the youngest goalscorer in Euro 2024 history with his first-minute goal.
Emre Can scored a late winner to secure Germany's victory.
Key Match Events: Germany scored early with Jamal Musiala's goal in the 10th minute.
Scotland responded with Ryan Porteous' goal in the 45th minute.
Antonio Rüdiger scored an own goal in the 87th minute.
Emre Can's late goal sealed the win for Germany.
Pre-Game Insights: Germany were heavy favorites heading into the match as hosts.
Scotland aimed to cause an upset but struggled to contain Germany's attack.
Post-Match Reflections: Germany's manager praised the team's performance and noted the importance of the win in their Euro 2024 campaign.
Scotland's players expressed disappointment but focused on improving for their next match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at the Allianz Arena in Munich with an attendance of 65,052 fans.
Referee Clément Turpin oversaw the game.
Others: The match was broadcast on FOX and ESPN BET.
